alert.note: Alert for Ventura (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 20 at 12:44PM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest California, including the following county, Ventura. * WHEN...Until 830 PM PDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Widespread roadway and small stream flooding is expected across Ventura County, especially in low lying and poor drainage areas. Rapid rises in streams,creeks, and normally dry arroyos are expected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1236 PM PDT, Doppler radar and rain gauge reports indicated moderate to heavy rain was overspreading much of central and eastern Ventura County, with rainfall rates between 0.20 and 0.50 inches per hour becoming common. Moderate to heavy rain will spread into western Ventura County through this afternoon as well. Rain intensities will likely increase this afternoon and evening, with a Flood Watch in effect for the potential of dangerous and life threatening flash flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Oxnard, Thousand Oaks, Simi Valley, Ventura, Camarillo, Fillmore, Ojai, Agoura Hills, Chatsworth, Woodland Hills, Moorpark, Santa Paula, Port Hueneme, Rose Valley, Lockwood Valley, Ventura Harbor, Mount Pinos, Newbury Park, La Conchita and Point Mugu State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Arroyos, streams, and rivers can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
